section: Company guarantees to deliver the Client Website in the time frame specified in the Scope of Work. Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are not subject to any delay.
explanation: The contract guarantees delivery within a specified timeframe, but then states that due dates are not subject to any delay. This is contradictory because it suggests an absolute guarantee alongside an acknowledgement that delays are impossible, which is unrealistic. Guarantees inherently imply the possibility of failure or delay.

section: Client agrees that any unsolicited positive feedback Client provides to Company may be used in any Company marketing and/or advertising materials (i.e., customer testimonials).
explanation: This section lacks clarity regarding consent. While it states unsolicited positive feedback may be used, it doesn't explicitly state the client consents to this use or that they have the right to revoke this consent. This is ambiguous as it could be interpreted as an implied consent which may not hold up legally.

section: Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work.
explanation: The term 'completion of the Scope of Work' is vague. It's not clear what constitutes 'completion'. Does it mean when the website is fully functional, or when all stages outlined in Exhibit A are finished, or some other benchmark? This ambiguity could lead to disputes about when the final payment is actually due.
